DO. NOT. BUY.  Game looks great for the first couple of hours but then the fun dies out. Where to begin? We'll try some pro's first.  PRO'S:  Good vehicle variety Good graphics Mini Games Amusing charachters (mostly Trevor)  Cons:  Good graphics is one of only 4 pro's that I can think of. Any game that is considered good only because of graphics, in my opinion, is not worth playing. I'd much rather have low quality graphics and a fun game than a dull game with great graphics.  Mini games... sorta. In a game where I would expect to find mostly racing and FPS elements there is very little racing and only passable FPS. Apparently you are supposed to waste alot of your time playing mini games like golf, tennis, darts, yoga, things that are not very fun mini games with a normal controler. If you wanted to play these things on a wii... sure might be fun. Not so much here. Some of these 'mini games' or breaks in the game are mandatory and extremely dull/ pointless. In one mission you have to mop.... yes as in the thing that's like a broom that gets wet, a mop. For mopping. Wouldn't be to bad since it's part of the storyline, you are pretending to be a janitor while you do other things, but you can't move while you mop. You just go up to a 'dirty' spot and try to mop it by pushing a button. No auto aiming or moving character while he's mopping. Yes you also have to (sort of) aim your mop by walking upto, but still far enough from bc you don't mop anywhere near your feet, and push the button for mop. 2 mops and you return to the mop bucket because the mop is dirty. Sound like I'm going on about mopping alot? That's because I am because that is by far the dumbest thing I have ever paid for in a game. Another pointless break is on the final 'heist'. You break away from normal control for a 2D map of the city with... idk 14 intersections? Your job is to control the traffic lights to keep your vehicals from getting caught. Boring. Then after you win, and it is either a 100% win or a loss, you are immediately caught. Dumb. So dumb and boring. So, yeah, those mini games and breaks are no longer a 'Pro'  The start of the game makes it look like you will get to do alot of awesome jobs, heists, robberies, whatever you want to call them. You don't. I believe you make 4 paying ones and a couple nonpaying jobs for the government. Still, those 4 could be really awesome, right? Well, they almost are. You get to pick your crew for the job, though if you pick anybody cheap they either get killed, arrested, or do such a poor job that you end up losing more than you saved on their pay. So, really you *have* to pick the higher skilled people. Also, something that irritates me to no end, your gunmen, especially in the last mission, don't even attack. Think about that, the final mission, the BIG score, so big your crew is twice as big as usual, 2 gunmen, 2 drivers, and a hacker. While you are fighting off the people who just caught you after you were forced to 'play' a minigame to avoid, your 2 gunmen do not fire a single shot. No, of course not, I mean, they are only gunmen, why would they use guns, right? Instead they are put to work moving your stolen goods from one set of vehicles to another while you get shot at. I cannot express how incredibly stupid that is. Anyway, so yeah you are supposed to be able to hire cheaper crew members and have them gain xp to be better in future missions but they die or get caught in the first several so there's no real use to them as you (obviously) can't use them after that happens. Each heist has setup missions, one of which is to stash a getaway vehicle 'in the place of your choosing.' Except you can't leave the vehicle pretty much anywhere useful. The first time I lucked out and found what is apparently the only usable place in the game. The second time I kept getting messages for why the location is unusable. Too close to heist location, too close to police station (makes sense), not discreet enough, on a road... On a road? I parked in a parking space? Yellow lines on either side, in a parking lot, with parked cars beside me? How is that on a road? As for the 'not discreet enough' excuse, the place that I finally parked the car? An exposed parking lot on one of the main streets in plain view. ???????  Racing... or lack thereof. Sure there's stunt missions for planes and some water races, but what about the car races? Just 2, and not that great in my opinion. This alone could have nearly saved the game.  Plenty of other irritating things but lets start wrapping this up. End of game is EXTREMELY dull unless of course watching paint dry sounds fun to you. Frank can hunt metal 'spaceship' pieces, though no hint is given as to where they are and I never bothered to hunt them down, Michael can hunt 'submarine' pieces, found 3 and then had to return to dock to unload them, in a very, very, very slow sub that took several minutes to get to the first one. Again you are not told where they are, you just sail around until your sonar pings and you get a very general idea of where to go. Considering it took me about half an hour to find the first 3 closest pieces, I have absolutely no desire to hunt down the rest of the 50. Trevor has to find a truck with pills in it and, you guessed it, no indication of where the truck might spawn. Near a hospital? No luck there. On the highway? well if it is it's pretty rare because I spent another half hour driving from one side of the map to the other and no sign of it.   In the end, this is an *almost* awesome game. It feels to me like the said 'let's make the best game ever', got 95% of the way there and said 'okay lets stop here.' Needs more racing, more heists, more relevant options for heists, like your gunman just doesn't shoot as well and puts more pressure on you instead of not shooting at all even if you get the best or getting caught/ killed with no way to avoid it.

I have spent $60 pre- ordering Max Payne 3 before it was released. I spent $60 US on GTA 5. I have never played either game, and, most likely, I never will. The problem I have isnt with the games per say; it is with the rock star social club (which is a fancy way of saying always online DRM with a lot of snazzy social features). At some point i must have logged onto my steam acccount at a close friends house and now, somehow in a way that only rock star can explain, my steam account is linked to his rockstar social club account. That means that when i try to launch many of rockstars games i get one of two different errors (depending on the game). Both errors can only be fixed by submitting tickets with many screenshots, serial numbers, and screen shots of serial numbers. In my life i have bought 1000's of games (many with very restrictive DRM). In my life I have also only submitted tickets on MMOs. I have neither the time nor the patience to waste more time (other than the hours of research i have wasted on the internet looking into this issue) than I already have. I wont be submitting a ticket so that rockstar can be convinced I am not attempting to pirate their triple A multi- billion dollar franchise. I would rather spend my time playing any of the hundreds of games i currently have access to. Their DRM (if they have any) is not so restrictive that their customer service gets overwhelmed when they launch a product and/ or patch a product. This seems to be a problem only rockstar and ubisoft have.

This Payday 2 DLC has it all... Masks, guns, gun mods... It even took the concept of driving cars from that one heist no one liked and expanded on it, adding an open world, bank heists you have to actually prepare for (sadly there's still drilling, but at least they improved that too!), the list goes on. It's even got mindless PvP for those that just like to hold W and the left mouse button all day and think it's a game.  Overall, a bit pricy for a re-mastered version of the original game, but well worth it when you realize it includes all of the DLC, weapons etc., with a streamlined level process that takes all of the RNG out of unlocking your favorite items.  Bonus: It still has the 'kawaii' mask.  6/11/15: Yep. Totally unjustifiable, shady, straight up BS business practices and broken patches ruin another once good game.

I bought this for the single player. I was very disappointed with Grand Theft Auto 4's crazy lag. GTA San Andreas was good until the flying mission. Didn't play much of Vice City but it didn't impress me. GTA3 was probably the laggiest, most unplayable game in the history of video games. I liked the 2d games but those were from ages ago and not the direction that the franchise went with.  So I didn't really have high hopes for GTA5. But all the reviews were glowing. So I reluctantly bought it at a premium price (£40 or something).  Well, it doesn't lag on my computer so it has GTA3 and GTA4 beat. But it's not fun. It's boring. And crazy easy. The checkpoints are good because I didn't like having to drive to the mission again in previous games. But there's numerous checkpoints within the mission. There should have just been one at the start.   And even then, if you don't want to do the missions you can skip them. But how bad a player would you have to be to not be able to complete the missions? I've nearly finished the game and there was only one mission I had trouble with. But in order to solve this problem, I just reloaded to an earlier save and bought some armour.   I can write a book on why this game isn't any good but I'll leave it here. I haven't played the online portion but from what I've read, I'm not missing anything.  Pwninator score: 2/10

Great Time Loading: Five Star Crashing Simulator  Honestly, it's a good game, love playing it, but the downsides are way too drastic. I've yet to play for more than an hour without a crash and managed to find a few game breaking glitches. The crashes come as soon as I change from a constant. Looking behind myself too quickly is rewarded with a crash, driving off the road while driving too fast is rewarded with a crash. I've only been able to have about a 1 in 3 chance of getting through a heist, 1/3 is me crashing, 1/3 is someone else leaving (which I'm led to beleive is them crashing), while that last 1/3 is dependent on how well your team does. In the past 24 hours I've downloaded 205.3 Gigs of GTA:V and every single time I downloaded a fresh copy there were at least 2 corrupted files found upon validation.

It's with a heavy heart I have to give GTA V a bad review - for now. I, like many other laptop users with mobile graphics cards, are experiencing crashing issues nonstop that has completely ruined the experience. Story mode, I get a crash roughly every 5-10 loading screens, online (the main reason I bought the game), I get a crash every loading screen so I haven't gotten to play it yet at all. I also randomly get crashes on startup. It's really a bummer. I'm a poor college kid so when I spend 60 on a game it's a huge deal to me. It's a bigger deal when I spend that 60 and I can't play the game.  Aside from that, the game is really excellent, and when this issue is resolved and I can play the game I will edit this review to reflect the true nature of the game. However, because I can't play the game for more than a half hour at a time before I experience a crash, I can't recommend this game to anyone, ESPECIALLY laptop users who use mobile graphics cards. From what I've read, Rockstar doesn't have a fix for these issues pending just yet so save your money and buy when you know you're going to be able to actually play the game and get the experience you paid for.

As much as I've had fun playing GTA online on console, I don't enjoy it as much as I did on console, whereas the PC version... you're so laggy, you fail races, deathmatches, heists, because of the ♥♥♥♥ing lag stutter. Another problem, on top of the lag stutter, and in races/death match, players are able to lag out the way or in the way, and collide with you, as well as glitch checkpoints in 30 player jobs. There is also a problem with Rockstar servers, I'm kicked for being idle for too long... 30 seconds to be exact, right after having a ♥♥♥♥ in the toilet, I come back to that. Why am I not allowed to take a break? Rockstar, your gaming standards are utter ♥♥♥♥♥. What do you know, you use ♥♥♥♥ buckets? It isn't terrible, but I certainly don't recommend it.

I bought this for the online part, and only that. So my review is for the online part of the game, and nothing else.   Remember back in the day, when we were without SSD disks? Yeah, I do, and even then, loading times weren't as long as they are in GTA Online. I mean, there is no difference if you put it on a HDD or an SSD, it loads as sirup anyway.  The online part of the game, is made up of different online servers, so when you start the game, you would expect to get a choise in what server you would like to join? Maybe you would like to join the server where all of your friends currently are? Well, that aint happening. Cus what happens when you start GTA Online, is that you will load directly into a random server. No options served. Because of this, you will first have to start up the game once, and wait for the insanely long loading time, then, when you actually are in the game, you can get trought the meny, to enter the same server as your friends. This makes the already 1min+ loading-time to a 2min+ loading-time.  When you actually get around to playing, it quite fast becomes repetitive. It feels like one of the cheap Korean grindfest mmo. In what ways can you get money? Well, lets see... You can steal a car, deliver it to the buyer, wait 5 minutes before you can deliver another car. Each car will bring you something between 800-3000 dough.  Or you could go and kill someone for a bounty? Well, good luck in that, cus when someone gets a bounty on their head, every player in a 5km radius comes driving with all their guns ready.  Also the highets bounty you can get is $9000.  Another possibility is doing heists. Most heists require a four man team, and they are the easiest way to get money. The thing is that it costs a bit to start a heist, and then you have to split the money to all the four guys, and then you gotta pay for all the ammo you used in the heist.  When some of the heists then take up till three hours plus, and you earn maybe $250.000, its really not worth it. Also to plan the 'larger' heists, you will need an appartment that costs about $200.000 - 500.000+.  When you play a game, that goot 'online' in its title, and a big part of the game is doing missions with your friends, you might think that there will be a 'group' or 'party' feature in that game. I mean, even APB got a party feature! Well, in GTA Online, there is no such thing.  The people you have in your friendslist, and that are on the same server as you, will have a blue ring around their 'dot' on the map, thats it. Thats all the information about friends you will get.  Let's see, wicht other features are there in this game?  Well, you got racing. But there really is not a whole lot of maps. And another thing about racing, is that you got to have a host, for the race. And in the host 'settings' he can choose to enable/disable a feature (thats on by default) that makes it so that every car that gets behind in the race, will get a boost to their car's speed... And the guy thats good at driving, and currently got the lead of the race, well he will get a decrease in his car's max speed. What kind of idiot thought that adding a feature like this was a good idea?   You also got deathmatch, witch can be played in a few different ways.  The old quake way, where you run around in the map, picking up weapons and armor.   Or the unfair way, where every player has the weapons witch he has bought in the gunstore for himself. Meaning that you could get in a deathmatch with a player that got every weapon and nade that GTA has to offer, while you might only have a pistol and a rifle. It's a 'really' fun mode to play in.  After having played the game myself, and having talked with friends about it. I'm NOT recomanding anyone to buy GTA Online.  You kinda would expect a game that has gotten so much media covering, to bring something new to the table, right?Well it doesn't. You might as well go and play APB (All-points bulletin), since it got mostly all the same features as GTA Online has. And before you come here and say that APB is a free to play buy to win game, think a bit about the fact that you can buy ingame money through Microtransactions in GTA as well.

PS4 version looks and runs better. It can feel nice for a bit at 60fps but frequent frame drops destroy the experience. There is also a very restrictive graphics options menu, as in you can change the options but the game will not let you play the game if it thinks you are out of memory. This can happen often as the game does not pick up on multiple graphics cards and large amounts of ram. A better port than GTAIV but its still not a high enough quality to warrant purchasing this version. Only buy if you have a rig way above the reccomended settings and can afford a new hard drive because this is a resource hog and a disgusting large game to install. All in all the order for GTA V goes PS4/XBONE > PC >360/ PS3.

Although Grand Theft Auto V is wonderful in some aspects (vehicle handling and the visuals), it falls flat on what makes games enjoyable. The story is boring and lacks any sort of emotion. Once you've gone through the lackluster story, you've basically done all you can in singleplayer. There is no amount of replayability in singleplayer and the rest of the game hinges on the disappointment that is Grand Theft Auto Online. Loading screens are all the gameplay that you'll get in GTA Online with some bouts of shooting and running around. The 5 main online heists are boring and extremely linear and also lack replayability as you'll just be doing the same thing over and over in order to scrap together some cash. Overall, I would say that Grand Theft Auto V is an extremely realistic simulation of the present day USA whereby you want to constantly kill yourself because of the disappointment you call 'life' as you scrap together cash and constantly get your time wasted.  Edit: With the new update, you're able to become a CEO. Although this lets you have a little more power in the game with your aquisition of an office and warehouse, the whole crate system was likely thought up overnight. You can order 1-3 crates which will either spawn in a truck or on seperate helicopters. Then, you're forced to battle with other players as they will get currency by destroying your crates. Finally, if you've lucked out and gotten one truck with all of the crates on it, your can just deliver it to your warehouse. If you had the misfortune of having seperate helicopers carrying the crates, you're forced to shoot down one at a time as you can only carry one crate at a time. Not only are you forced to take more time out of your day in order to get a substandard income, but you're also restricted with a time limit. So not only can you not carry all of the crates, but you're forced to try to drive across the map multiple times within a given time in order to achieve that meesly income. Overall, I don't see how being a CEO means you're the damned delivery man. They had might as well just called this Grand Theft Postal Service and given me the uniform as I feel it would've been a more accurate representation. In my opinion, a whole series of missions dedicated to your company would have been a better waste of my time. Nonetheless, a better crate system would've sufficed. If the crates were to be picked up by anyone instead of being destroyed, I would see some sort of reasoning as you don't usually get money from destroying a crate. Not only that, but a better system of spawning these crates would've been worth while. Perhaps they could've had a delivery truck that was hijacked by some gang members or a delivery truck getting pulled over by the police. However, we're stuck with this half-♥♥♥♥♥ update that hasn't provided any new (or innovative), well thought out ideas.

Shockingly Poor! As a huge fan of a stunning GTA4, I had high expectations for #5. Yet despite 5 years work by 1,000 developers, the game - which seems potentially large enough for 300-400 hours of content - has at absolute best 80.  The content that there is feels....rushed and slapped together. Most of it consists of 'go to this place as fast as you can.' The story script, unlike the rather tight and compelling GTA4 script, was again weak, as if scribbled together hurriedly and without much concern. There are many inconsistencies in the game as well. Worst was the police reaction to player actions - sometimes they were on sight instantly, other times they wouldn't even react to a crime. There seemed no rhyme or reason to it. I never thought it possible, but I actually have to give this 2 out of 5 stars. It's actually somewhat unlikely at this point that I'll plunk down money for a GTA6.

Story Mode is pristine, graphics are polished and the gameplay was relatively smooth. I didn't notice a storyline expansion or anything else that different from the 360 release like 2 years ago, but then again, it was 2 years ago and I don't really remember.    The multiplayer is chaotic as usual with no proximity based VON, so you get to hear every person in the session screaming into their mics, spamming music, yelling at their mom or whatever is happening. I have to say that the proximity VON is a big issue to me since heist mode is so communication oriented, I'd have figured R* would have worked something out. Aside from the desync of p2p combat and the mic spam, I had a great time online playing heists with friends and causing general mayhem. One huge buzzkill is that the Online loading and matchmaking times are horrendous. Just getting in is time consuming, not to mention if for some reason the session suddenly cant be reached or you get dropped from the heist lobby because the host fk'd off somewhere you may be kicked back to single player, have to load that, then reconnect to online and sit in loading purgatory some more. I'm saying the load times Online are insane. Other than that I've had a great time racking up those stars and leaving a trail of chaos in tricked out cars with friends Online.    EDIT - Multiplayer is filled with script kiddies that spam trainer menus and ruin the gameplay. From blowing everyone up, to crashing the session. This has been going on since release and R* has done nothing proactive to fix it. They instead have chosen a reactive route of relying on community based reporting rather than some sort of anti-cheat. If they are using an anti-cheat, they need to completely redesign it and fire whoever wrote it. As of right now I cannot recommend this game.    tl;dr   Do not buy this until R* fixes the massive issue with online script kiddies! The game itself is fantastic and worth playing, but the lack of anti-cheat cripples playing online in public servers. Put simply, Rockstar doesn't do nearly enough to maintain the online and it's shameful that they expect you to pay for Shark Cards when you could literally get free, modded cash in probably a couple hours of changing sessions looking for a nice modder to give you some. They also go after the FiveM mod team, whose goal is to make an independent online (like SA:MP) that could make use of dedicated servers and give loads of customization to what server owners could do with the game, which is extremely scummy. The lobby framework will never be updated either, which is a real shame as well.   Overall, Rockstar won't make Online better in terms of its structure, but will pump out content to pay for that will net them Shark Card sales. It's a real shame, and I'll continue to play, but supporting their business practices is not a good decision. At the very least, don't ever buy those Shark Cards, it's a waste of money and only endorsing their practices.

The saddest day of my life. I have to write a negative review... for GTA V. For so long I waited to see this game on PC. I abstained from playing it on consoles, knowing that a greater fate was awaiting me. I was saving myself for the PC version. I had the hardware. I had the means. I pre-ordered for myself and my friend. And after all that waiting and excitement, all I got was disappointment after disappointment. The single player campaign was too short/easy. The characters were dull (Trevor less so, but he was still disappointing). The world bore no real interest to me. To escape the boredom, I turned to the online mode. And that is where the brunt of this negative review comes in.  The online mode is  disgusting . The overall idea is good, and when it works, the gameplay is pretty immersive. But the execution is so appalling. For one, the profanity filter is utterly broken. And why is there a profanity filter in the first place? This isn't My Little Auto, this is Grand Theft Auto. You can wear a shirt that says 'Smell Like A ♥♥♥♥♥' but you can't say '♥♥♥♥♥'? What is this insanity? Did anyone even think this through?  And then there are the hackers. It's like Rockstar are doing absolutely nothing about it. Hackers are so prevalent that you could rejoin lobbies over and over for hours and not find a single one without a hacker or two. Of course, that would only be about 4 or 5 lobbies you join because  It takes so ♥♥♥♥ing long to load this game. Holy ♥♥♥♥ does it load. I'd say the gameplay to loading screen ratio is about 50/50, in all honesty. Maybe even less gameplay if you're doing heists. Which reminds me:  I would also like to include the community as a point of negativity in this review, because even DayZ's community doesn't have this many self-entitled ♥♥♥♥♥♥ in it's midst. Most everyone is so bitter about whatever is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ them off that they don't even try to help anymore. There are so many threads cluttered on google search results that yield nothing but stupid responses like 'well why didn't you buy an SSD, they're not that expensive' or 'wow I wish we could hide all the threads about the hackers'. It's this massive 'blame the user' circle-jerk that never ends because everyone is still caught up in the hype. Granted, not everyone is like that, but most people are, and communities are largely represented by their majority.  GTA V was supposed to be amazing, and it looks like it from a distance. But these problems (and many more) make it a boring chore of an experience. Christ, the difficulty I've had just getting my friends to play this game - I had one friend who can only play this game once per boot. If he doesn't restart his PC before loading the game a second time, the game will stay stuck on the loading screen infinitely. Then we have my friend who has the infamous black bars that appear on the side of the screen when doing internet stuff or (more crucially) the hacking game on the fleeca job. Get snake from point A to point B... except point B (and some of the path to point B) is offscreen because of those black ♥♥♥♥ing bars. It's a literal guessing game, and it's been that way for MONTHS. And my problems? Well, if I try to play the game with a controller, it randomly freezes every 30 seconds or so. The freezes only last about 2 seconds, but it's super disruptive.   I can't figure out what the hell Rockstar are thinking. Have they got dollar signs in their eyes? Are they so cocky and arrogant due to the financial success of the game that they feel they don't need to listen to anyone? Or are they just plain stupid? Either way, this game is a disappointment. One of the biggest ones of my life so far. Never meet your heroes I guess - maybe I would have been happier if they simply said '♥♥♥♥ it, no PC release'. I will never buy another Rockstar game again, and my love for gaming in general has been jaded by this game; I have a newfound cynicism for so many things now. Congratulations Rockstar, I hope you people are happy with yourselves.

Where to start off? So i was really looking forward into this game after i played more than 300 hours on my xbox 360. After i seen no more updates were coming into the PS3 and X360 i decided to get it on PC. I cannot say anything bad about the optimization, yeah i'll be honest and i will say i have stuttering and some freezing/frame drop problems but that's because i have a dual core i3 3220 and 4GB ram for a game like this.  The game itself is amazing. Amazing details in all the aspects of the game, amazing story, sound,gameplay(even tho gta v isn't trying to be realistic like gta 4) but we are going into the multiplayer part. Boy, it's a mess. On the consoles i didn't have any problems because on the consoles you rarely meet any hacker or modder so it was an amazing experience as for multiplayer, but on PC it's just bad. You thought that Valve's anti-cheat is slow and sometimes useless? Ohh boy, you didn't see Rock$tar's. With some luck i didn't get banned because of hackers or modders because they didnt throw money on me or something, but they were ruining the game. Killing everybody, spawning the most ridiculous and gigantic things and so on. I won't talk about the customer support because it's even more useless than the anti-cheat. Also GTA Online became from a while a money maker for R*. The content is free in some way, but is overpriced up to hell so you need to buy shark cards (ingame money) to gain those items. At this point R* are worse than EA.  And we all know that Rock$tars scammed a lot of people in the Summer Sale of 2015 when they bundeled the game with shark cards so they can raise the price up to 80$/Euros so they can add a 25% of promotion just to sell the game at the normal full price of 60$/euros. Really silly move Rock$tar. Shame on you!  At the current state i can recommend the game only for the story mode, because it is amazing. But the online component is disease on the PC right now. I would suggest geting the game on consoles (PS4/XBONE) just because you won't get any hackers/modders and if you get you will get them VERY RARELY!

This game was impressive to me at first (I started playing 6 months ago to give a time frame). I soon found myself disliking it however. For one I found finding a server with a decent player count to be incredibly tedious. Then when I found a server I was almost 7 times more likely to encounter a hacker than I was in a CS: GO competitve match, which is saying something. I respect the work that Rockstar did and they did a lot right in this game but if you want to do anything after the campaign it can be a tedious and frustrating. However all is not bad and I have had fun times meeting people and setting up fun custom games. All in all I can say that I have had some fun times in GTA 5 but I wouldn't recommed it to anyone at full retail price. Originally I had positively rated this game, but I didn't take into consideration the cancer that is GTA Online. The servers are rarely fully functional and when they are, they're full of russians. Also the community for this game is terrible and Rockstar has done nothing to discourage players from mindlessly killing and destroying other players' property. So pretty much when you get in a GTAO lobby, you kill everyone on sight because your head is on the chopping block from the time you exit your home. There are also a lot of modders, but I think GTA has bigger fish to fry. The community really ruins the online experience of this game. No cooperation, no teamwork, no friendly players, and no consideration of ever not killing everyone on sight. You constantly have to recover your vehicles from the insurance people who don't even pick up their phone half of the time. And then you have to retrieve it only to have it blown up immediately after. Its a continous cycle of everyone killing everything and its not fun for either party.   If you're buying it for the single player experience, then that's good for you, but don't buy it for the online. You'll be very dissapointed.
